title: Which one is better for home recording between the BOSS ME-25, BOSS GT-6, or Zoom G3Xn? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let’s remove the Boss ME-25 as it is not in the league of the other two. Between the GT-6 and the G3Xn, the Boss is a sturdy, flexible, more analog tweaking, pedal but it is no longer in production (and I don’t like buying used stomp boxes as they can get a beating. The Zoom is a modern, three display, highly programmable pedal and is still in the market. It has less amp emulations and simultaneous effects but it is a good pedal and, unless you can get a new GT6, I’ld go with the Zoom. Now, all of that said, if you are going to record your guitar in a computer using a DAW and an interface, why not us the tons of effect apps available out there?
The Boss GT-6 is probably the best choice between the three. If you want to learn more details about the products you can always watch their reviews on YouTube.
